clinical_study.brief_title: Dielectric Property Test Compared With Frozen Pathological Section in the Rapid Diagnosis of Lung Nodules/Mass
clinical_study.official_title: Dielectric Property Test Compared With Frozen Pathological Section in the Rapid Diagnosis of Lung Nodules/Mass: a Diagnostic Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

clinical_study.source: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with lung nodules/mass found by CT (computed tomography) or PET (positron emission tomography) who agree to receive lung resection are arranged to test the dielectric property before receiving the frozen pathological examination. And the final pathological results are recognized as the standard diagnosis. Then the sensitivity and specificity of the dielectric property test will be evaluated comparing with the frozen pathological examination.

primary_outcome.measure: sensitivity of dielectric property test in diagnosing lung nodules/masses
primary_outcome.description: true positive rate in diagnosing lung nodules/masses

primary_outcome.measure: specificity of dielectric property test in diagnosing lung nodules/masses
primary_outcome.description: true negative rate in diagnosing lung nodules/masses

arm_group.description: The patient with lung nodules/mass is firstly arranged to be tested for dielectric property after the nodules/mass resection and cutting open.
The resected lung nodules/mass will be sent for frozen pathological examination after dielectric property test.
The resected lung nodules/mass will undergo the final pathological examination for final diagnosis after dielectric property test and frozen pathological examination.

intervention.description: Test the dielectric property of resected lung nodules/mass through a touching probe after the lung tissue with nodules/mass has been resected and cut open, which usually takes only 1-5 minutes.
And after the dielectric property test, the lung tissue will be sent for frozen pathological examination.
All of the lung nodules/mass will be diagnosed by final pathological examination and recognized as the final diagnosis after surgery.
